Description:\n In Search of Lost Time follows the narrator\'s recollections of childhood and experiences into adulthood in the late 19th-century and early 20th-century high-society France, while reflecting on the loss of time and lack of meaning in the world. Originally published: 1913 Original language: French

Description:\n lysses chronicles the appointments and encounters of the itinerant Leopold Bloom in Dublin in the course of an ordinary day, 16 June 1904. Originally published: December 1920 Original language: English

Description:\n The plot of Don Quixote, a Spanish novel written in 1605, contains some of the best representations of this vision. Considered a founding work of modern Western literature, the novel\'s message that individuals can be right while society is wrong was considered radical for its day. Originally published: 1605 Original language: Spanish, Korean, Old Spanish, Early Modern Spanish

Description:\n This is the author\'s epic tale of seven generations of the Buendía family that also spans a hundred years of turbulent Latin American history, from the postcolonial 1820s to the 1920s. Patriarch José Arcadio Buendía builds the utopian city of Macondo in the middle of a swamp. Originally published: 1967 Original language: Spanish

Description:\n Set in Jazz Age New York, it tells the tragic story of Jay Gatsby, a self-made millionaire, and his pursuit of Daisy Buchanan, a wealthy young woman whom he loved in his youth. Originally published: April 10, 1925 Original language: English
